meanings.definition: A form of traditional Japanese puppet theater.
meanings.sent1: The bunraku show was filled with colorful puppets.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy watching bunraku performances in Japan.
meanings.sent3: During the bunraku play, the puppets danced in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The magic of bunraku brings wooden characters to life on stage.
meanings.sent5: The audience was mesmerized by the intricate movements of the bunraku puppets.

meanings.definition: The puppet used in bunraku performances.
meanings.sent1: The bunraku puppet had detailed features and beautiful costumes.
meanings.sent2: The puppeteer skillfully manipulated the bunraku on stage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous bunraku puppet winked at the audience during the show.
meanings.sent4: The bunraku puppet seemed to have a life of its own, captivating the viewers.
meanings.sent5: Children were amazed by the lifelike movements of the bunraku puppet.

meanings.sent1: The bunraku style of puppetry involves intricate movements and storytelling.
meanings.sent2: Artists train for years to master the art of bunraku.
meanings.sent3: In the world of bunraku, even the smallest puppet has a big personality.
meanings.sent4: The elegance of bunraku puppetry is admired worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The history of bunraku puppetry dates back centuries in Japan.
